item.title: A large ton bag has been dumped on the pavement, 24th September
item.description:
A large builder's ton bag has been dumped on the pavement on Cross Road - outside the black building site near the junction with Bowes Road. It is full of rubbish and garden cuttings.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Cross Road, New Southgate, London

item.title: New Grafitti on the next window, 24th September
item.description:
The street is full of grafitti, there are gangs in the neighbourhood and doesn’t seem to be an issue for the council. Today we can see a new grafitti on the next window of the empty shop Can pleas someone do something, we have children in this building and we are being harrased

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 365, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pills of full dog waste bags, 24th September
item.description:
I have reported dog waste being dump at this spot a few times before, but people continue to leave their waste here. As you can see from the photo it is dumped behind and all around the electrical box. Some are large bags with massive amounts of dog waste. This is right next to Alexandra Junior School, so children are walking past it everyday. Bromley council have always cleared up the mess when reported, but it is an on going problem. Could a fee sign be placed here to deter re-offending? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cator Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Influx of graffiti along Atlantic road Brixton SW9, 24th September
item.description:
There has been an influx of graffiti along Atlantic road SW9. The graffiti is mainly on the brick walls it starts from 56 Atlantic road and leads to 389. There is a fair amount of graffiti some of it is abusive language. Please can the graffiti be jet-sprayed off the wall and the graffiti painted over. Unfortunately Atlantic road, Electric Avenue, and Coldharbour lane seem to be the hotspots of graffiti in this area. The graffiti has been there for over a year

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coldharbour Lane, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
